definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: I have more squires than I know what to do with.
sentences.chinese: 我的侍從多的不知道該打發他們去幹什麼。

sentences.english: He is equerry to the Prince of Wales.
sentences.chinese: 他是威爾士親王的侍從。

sentences.english: His attendants pretended to pick up the long train at the back of his cloak.
sentences.chinese: 侍從們假裝拾起皇帝披風后那長長的後裾。

sentences.english: Or long-hair'd page in crimson clad.
Buddha preached the sorcery to 5 attendants such as Kaundinya etc. in Sarnath.
sentences.chinese: 佛祖在鹿野苑向他的侍從憍陳如等五人說法道。

sentences.english: Lord Ramsay's squire, was he not?
sentences.chinese: 拉姆西大人的侍從，是麼？
內侍羅馬教皇的名譽侍從。

sentences.english: The lack is not confined to valets .
sentences.chinese: 但想象力的缺乏並不僅限於侍從。

sentences.english: Dido, with a numerous body of friends and followers, both men and women, succeeded in effecting their escape from Tyre.
sentences.chinese: 狄多成功地帶着一大批男女朋友和侍從逃出了提爾。

sentences.english: The yeoman warders manage it now.
sentences.chinese: 如今是御用侍從衛士在管理。

sentences.english: The police motorcycle escort dismounts and stands stiffly to attention.
sentences.chinese: 旁邊警察的摩托車護衛着侍從，一動不動的站着。

sentences.english: Another attendant delivered my bag a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 幾分鐘後另一個侍從把包給我拿了過來。

sentences.english: In front of the Buddha are two mighty stone lions; on two sides are four followers.
sentences.chinese: 主尊前有兩隻姿態雄健的石獅，左右侍立侍從。

sentences.english: Other figures in the temple include four eunuchs and a few female servants in men's clothes.
sentences.chinese: 殿內的彩塑侍從人物，有四名宦官及幾名男裝侍女。

sentences.english: The attendants attend the meeting and  pretend to be attentive.
sentences.chinese: 侍從們出席會議並裝出專注的樣子。

sentences.english: Enter duke, aegeon, gaoler, officers, and other attendants.
sentences.chinese: 公爵，伊濟安，獄卒，官吏等，及其他侍從等上。

definition: warm room/warm partition of a room
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
